intro: Mirabilis longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered four o'clock, is a species native to South America. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces striking, tubular-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, opening in the late afternoon and closing by morning. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and branching. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and containers.
